msItem.title: Siyar al-muta'akhkharin.
msItem.note: The text is preceded by 3 added folios with a list of contents, not by the original scribe. F1a: signature of Ellis, dated 8.9.98, F1b, signature in pencil: Paget Ruled margins. Headings and punctuation in red.

listBibl.bibl: Other copies in the collection, Nos 110-113.

bindingDesc.p: Brown half-leather and marbled paper binding with tooled decoration, including Persain title on spine. A history of Mughal India in the eighteenth century. This manuscript is not volume 2 as stated on the binding and inside the front cover. It contains parts 1 and 2 in Storey's description. On f521a the author states that he intends to continue with the history from the twenty-first year of the reign of Muhammad Shah. This is dated 26 Muharram 1195. Apparently a variant recension. Ends with a description of some of the customs of the English and a discussion of the causes of disorder in the (Mughal) kingdom.

availability.p: Visitors are welcome to consult manuscripts in the library by prior appointment. Information on access is available on the library page of the Society's web site at www.royalasiaticsociety.org and appointments can be arranged by e-mailing library@royalasiaticsociety.org
